body: This is the result on the PASCAL VOC2007 test set
If I use the early stop strategy, I think I can only get a 0.62 mAP.

I don't have experience with PASCAL VOC2007 unfortunately. What mAP level are expecting?

You could try experimenting with the loss function in models.py. This seems to be key in changing performance. On the COCO side this repo will train to about 0.47 mAP, which unfortunately is below the darknet result of 0.58. Any suggestions or PRs are welcome!
Thank you, I think mAP should be 80%+ on PASCAL VOC+？

Hmm interesting. So from what you are saying PASCAL VOC is also training to a subpar mAP. In this case COCO training is closer to the state of the art mAP than PASCAL VOC it seems. Well, feel free to play around with the code. Changes in loss balancing, optimizers, lr schedulers, etc, all have huge effects on your results.

@Hello526 Can you write down the steps you have followed to train this repo on PASCAL VOC2007 (i.e. did you follow the instructions on https://github.com/pjreddie/darknet)? Also, I have not found mAP results for PASCAL VOC2007 test set. Can you point out your source?

@okanlv In fact, I am training in accordance with the code of glenn-jocher，I think the implementation of pytorch and darknet is not exactly the same. I just replaced yolov3.cfg with yolov3-voc.cfg ( https://github.com/pjreddie/darknet), the others have not changed, the training set is VOC2007 (no VOC2012 is used), and the test set is VOC2007. The change in learning rate and the error function are done according to what glenn-jocher said.

> I don't have experience with PASCAL VOC2007 unfortunately. What mAP level are expecting?
> 
> You could try experimenting with the loss function in models.py. This seems to be key in changing performance. On the COCO side this repo will train to about 0.47 mAP, which unfortunately is below the darknet result of 0.58. Any suggestions or PRs are welcome!

so for now, the default train config can get 0.522 mAP on coco (val2014 or val2017 or test-dev2017?), I also try some change on loss, but never get the mAP could be competitive with the result reported by the paper. Also I predict on test-dev2017 and get 56.1% mAP with the open model weights trained by darknet, but never reproduce with my model trained from scratch.

Yes, default settings should produce a 0.52 COCO2014 mAP around epochs 60-70, while the darknet weights produce about 0.58 on similar settings, both simply using test.py. Changes may be needed to acheive higher mAP, you're encouraged to tune hyperparameters and play around with the loss function yourself. Any positive results please let us know.
The code I reimplemented has already got 82%mAP on Pascal VOC 2007@Hello526.  https://github.com/Stinky-Tofu/Stronger-yolo
@Stinky-Tofu it would be very useful if you could train on COCO2014 as well to compare with darknet training.
I don't train it on coco2014, it will spend so much time, but the mAP of Tencent's reimplementation on pascal voc 2007 is 79.6

Yes COCO training takes a lot of time. Darknet trains for 270 epochs, which takes about 20 days on one 1080Ti. This repo trains in about 60 epochs (4 days), but does not reach the same accuracy as darknet unfortunately. How much time and epochs does VOC2007 training take?
About one day and 50 epochs on one 12G 1080Ti
